column1: For those who do not know
column2: the City of Penang lies on the western coast of the Malay Peninsula
column3: just below the Siamese border. It is the shipping point of the Federated Malay States
column4: where 65 per cent. of the world's tin is produced
column5: as well as a great amount of rubber and copra. With a population of 246
column7: it is growing by leaps and bounds and gives every indication of soon becoming one of the largest ports in the Far East.The thing that makes this city a point of importance in the present war is the fact that it is the last port of call for ships going from China and Japan to Colombo and Europe. As a result
column8: it has been made more or less of a naval base by the English Government. Large stores of Admiralty coal have been collected and all vessels have been commanded to stop here for orders before crossing the Bay of Bengal.
